answers.answer: Hi...  your message suggests that you have a family history of diabetes, and that you have some weight and other health issues (a recent fall?).  I am sad that you were not given any advice about how to improve your health.  I am NOT a doctor, but I really, really, encourage you to seek out expert advice about your health.  I can tell you, from my own experience, that any physical movement you are able to regularly safely do will help (for example, lifting and lowering your arms several times, walking again if you can, really any physical movement that is safe for you to do)..  otherwise, I think the most neglected aspect of medical care for helping diabetics is nutrition...  see a dietician or nutritionist if you can, and I will tell you that for me, adding a LOT of fiber to my diet really, really, really, helped to lower my blood sugar *without* changing my diet *too* much... and there are SO many fiber products available now that it is pretty easy to increase your fiber intake; it slows down digestion of sugars and carbs, makes you feel full so you do not eat too much, and it helps make you "regular" ...I wish you well and hope you feel better soon.

question: I am confused about my prediabetes diganosis.  I was not told to do anything.  So I consider it uncontrolled - what should I be doing?  My father, my aunty both had adult diabeties.  My grandmother got it in her 80s.I stand 5ft 8inches and weigh 215lbs - each time I try to reduce my weight I just put more on.  Until a recent fall, I did do a lot of walking.  My physio said I had an excellent walking habit - but due to other problems I am unlikely to get back to that stage of physical movement.Any advice greatly appreciated
title: Pre Diabeties - What Do I Do?
